Key Arguments: The bill undermines freedom of speech by creating two classes of citizens: those who can disseminate information freely and regular citizens who cannot.
The legislation will lead to excessive restrictions on speech by digital service providers.
Judging the truthfulness of information is inherently difficult as new information can change previously accepted facts.
The bill targets not only false information but also true information deemed misleading or deceptive, which could stifle open discussion.
The bill risks silencing regular citizens who have found their voices online.
Notable Quotes: This bill demonstrates a severe lack of respect for the freedom of speech that we, as citizens, hold dear.
Attempting to accurately judge what is true or untrue is an impossible task.
Freedom of speech is invaluable as it allows for open and honest discussions without limits.
